lines.gurmukhi: AnBY Bvn pRym Bgiq mukiq dÍwr cwro bsu cwro kuMt rwjq rwjwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Anabhai Bhavan Praym Bhagati Moukati Dvaara , Chaaro Basu Chaaro Kount Raajat Raajaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The door of the True Guru is perpetual source of knowledge, a place where His slaves are ever involved in His loving worship and His loving maids are praying for salvation.

lines.gurmukhi: jwgRq sÍpn idn rYn auT bYT cil ismrn sÍn sukiRq prvwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaagrat Svapan Din Rain Outth Baitth Chali , Simaran Sravan Soukrit Paravaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: That human being is ever accepted at the door of the True Guru who utters and listens to His divine name awake, sleeping, sitting, standing or walking. This for him is the supreme task for him.

lines.gurmukhi: joeI joeI AwvY soeI BwvY pwvY nwmu inD Bgiq vCl mwno bwjq nIswn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Joee Joee Aavai Soee Bhaavai Paavai Naamu Nidha , Bhagati Vachhal Maano Baajat Neesaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: All those who come to the door of the True Guru with devotion and love are accepted by the True Guru. He acquires the invaluable treasure of Name. It seems the proclamation of Him being the lover of the worshippers is being sounded on His door in the form

lines.gurmukhi: jIvn mukiq swm rwj suK Bogvq AdBuq Cib Aiq hI ibrwjmwn hY ]619]
lines.transliteration_english: Jeevan Moukati Saam Raaj Soukh Bhogavata , Adabhout Chhabi Ati Hee Biraajamaan Hai ?619?

Shabad OS B.translation: All those human beings who take refuge on the door of the king of kings, they enjoy the wondrous comforts of the treasure of Name and becomes liberated while alive. Such wondrous beauty of the court of the True Guru is becoming well adorned.  (619)
